column4: When I try to install or boot from my flash drive I get the black screen. I was told to use nomodeset but I can't figure out how to use it.
what GPU do you use?
us:  nouveau.blacklist=1    instead
*use
How do I do that? This is my first time building a computer.
hold shift at boot
Nothing happened differently. It just went to the GRUB again.
how do I add the boot options? The shift thing does work.
That's one of my problems. I can only access GRUB when I boot. I can't get the welcome screen.
yes, thats because the nouveau driver is loading and your chip doesn't like it, hence the boot option
So how do I edit it? With the command line?
I have no idea what happened differently. Before I couldn't even access what you were describing in the page. Then I got it to work magically. Any idea what I may have done differently?
Do you know much about the nvidia drivers and which one I would have to download?
there are drivers in the ubuntu repos. You may need the xorg edgers update ppa as your chip will benefit from the 290 driver but its easily nstalled
I only started Linux in January. Could you simplify that?
the driver is in the ubuntu servers ready for you. You don't have to maually download anything
I tried it and it worked! I have no idea what I did differently.
what is the key?
What is a key?
to add the boot option>

I have no idea. I've been running into so many irregular problems. I had something with caching for the first day but that vanished quickly. Today I had the driver thing. I just booted regularly and it worked somehow.
anything you can pass on to no-name-
I have no idea what I did.
was afraid you'd say that
Yeah. I didn't do anything differently. It just worked.
no-name-: I think I hit escape but I'm not sure. I know once I got to that screen f6 had the option I needed.
is software centre or synaptic open, or are you installing updates or new apps?
the bootloader installer thingy is open from earlier when it ran into an error
yes, all one command
Bad address
sudo fuser -vki /var/lib/dpkg/lock;sudo dpkg --configure -a     is the command....
Errors in man-db
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh
Do you want me to run that code in the terminal?
please, select to upload to the server and a URL will be made, what is it please
http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=ec23669c5a30992323bf6930313763116b3d1894
if you run:  alsamixer    are all levels unmuted and cranked?
I have no idea how to tell. I've never used it before.
then try it....
There are: Master (green), Headphones (red) PCM (Red) Front (red) Front Mi (empty) <other> Front Mi (green) Surround (red) Center (red). I have no idea what each level means or what the names are.
are the levels high though?
and unmuted. You can use M to unmute
All except three are at the max.
max the others if you can
Some have green highight to the letters. How do I tell if with green or without green is mute?
use cursors and M, press ESC to exit
I tested both green highlight and without the highlight. Neither way I got sound'
I tested both settings after placing it and exiting. Neither worked.
I tried the sound thing and still nothing. Any idea what I should do next?
does the system have a make and model?
Nope. It's my first home built computer.
But it also doesn't work on my laptop which is an HP Pavilion dv6
for the HP DV6 you may need to run:    echo "options snd-hda-intel model=dell-m4-1 enable_msi=2" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf     and reboot
I tried that and it says it can't find the file or directory.
well yeah, if its released it's not in beta..
But was it "ready for prime time"?
according to the devs, yes
You helped me get my laptop audio working a bit ago. How do you think I'd do that for my desktop?
do what?
Get my sound working. It's not for some reason.
check the appdb, see which is friendliest
Or "PlayOnLinux"?
thats a gui but the backend doing the work is wine
Ahh...
When you say "friendliest", what do you mean?
the appdb shows what works and such, as well as the seam used
and wine used

So when I found Steam in the list and looked at it, it showed "Wine Version 1.3.37". Does that mean I should get 1.3? Also, why would one version work better than another? Are the numbers not released linearly like the Ubuntu releases (10.04 -> 10.11 -> 11.04 -> 11.0)
if you get wine 1.3 for your release it will work as well as it states in the appdb
the things should get added top your system menus like normal apps. they are in stalled to ~/.wine/drive_c
right click the top bar, its there
dr_willis: I feel dumb now. Thanks
its all learning, so its cool B)
Except that it was explained almost perfectly well.
hehe, you learn little bits like that as you go
Would purging ppa remove all of them or just what you want?
alternate can be used to upgrade offline and installs a desktop OS via text mode, live CD installs in GUI mode
no, just use the desktop one
Any idea why my laptop and my desktop look very different then?
different desktop environment and/or window manager
I haven't really noticed it on the main OS but for the login screen it's very different and I can't figure out why.
are they the same release?
Yep. Both 11.10 64 bit
and both using the gnome defaults with Unity and whatnot? or is one xubuntu or lubuntu etc?
both on Unity
are they both clean installs?
Yeah. I'm new to Ubuntu that I wasn't around before 11.10
you will mount the partition. If you run:  sudo fdisk -l   do you see the partition?
I think it's listed.
any, wine doesn't care as long as the data has appropriate access for the app to run
escott: Is there any file system that works better or worse?
not really, no. The default Ext4 will be fine
Thanks
with pulse, I believe so but I have no idea how
